column4: is there a way to purge package configuration files from packages that have already been removed?
sudo aptitude purge <package>
that will get rid of lingering config files?
that will remove system config files, not any that might be in your home
will that get rid of config files for active packages as well? it does not seem to discriminate?
to get rid of them all , do : aptitude , wait for it to load. Then l~c , shift_ , g (check that it's right) then g again
sorry,, what is l~g?

what that does, is limit the displayed packages that are not installed but are configured (l~c) shift_ (shift underscore) marks them for purging, g shows what will be done, g goes and does it. Escape (repeated) backs up.
